byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Moscow, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The proposed agreement would create a joint Russia-U.S. command center to share intelligence and targeting information for “integrated operations.”

headline.print_headline: Kerry Meets Putin to Talk Cooperation on Syria
headline.main: John Kerry Meets Vladimir Putin to Discuss New Syria Plan

snippet: The proposed agreement would create a joint Russia-U.S. command center to share intelligence and targeting information for “integrated operations.”...
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry meets with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin to discuss joint military strategy against Islamic State and Nusra Front in Syria; plan to coordinate airstrikes and intelligence draws criticism from some American officials, who worry deal is too favorable to Russia and Bashar al-Assad regime.
